greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by downwards antidiagonals: A(n, k) is the k-th term of a "Look to the left" sequence starting with 1,2,...,n  (see A293630).
link: Iain Fox, Antidiagonals n = 1..141 of array, flattened
formula: If k <= n, A(n, k) = k.
program: (PARI) row(n, k) = my(v=vector(n, i, i), w); while(#v<k, w=vector(#v-1, i, v[i]); for(y=1, v[#v], v=concat(v, w))); vector(k, i, v[i])
first(n, k) = my(v, m=matrix(0, k)); for(x=1, n, v=row(x+1, k); m=concat(m, v)); m
results.author: _Iain Fox_, Dec 07 2018
